bioghist.p: The Southeastern Pennsylvania Synod of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America is a collaborative partnership of congregations, institutions, rostered leaders and lay leaders on the territory of Southeastern Pennsylvania. According to its mission statement, the Mission of the Southeastern Pennsylvania Synod "is to oversee the life and ministry of this church in this territory so that: the Gospel of Jesus Christ is proclaimed; the witness of congregations is strengthened; people receive healing, justice and mercy; and the unity that our Lord gives is realized."

scopecontent.p: Types of materials: minutes, correspondence, reports, publications, printing cuts (the old metal designs), audio tapes dating in general from the 1930-1978 era, with most in the 1950-1968 period. There are a few published volumes of minutes dating from the 18th and 19th centuries. The majority of the collection is paper. Some portions of the collection will be easier to work through as they are sorted by topics as they appeared in a file (although some of this material is not always in order). Other boxes are much more disorganized and someone will need to figure out how to organize them better, although the contents per box generally relate to the same topic. Types of sub-collections: Bishop's general files 1930-1978 (21 boxes); Committee on Social Ministry 1957-1969 (1 box); Synod Office general files 1953-1974 (4 boxes); Board of Home Missions 1950-1969 (3 boxes); SEPA Synod, LCA general files 1955-1978 (17 boxes); SEPA Synod, LCA President's files 1953-1972 (6 boxes); SEPA Synod, LCA minutes, correspondence, financial files 1958-1969 (2 boxes). [Please note--some of the boxes have been separated into two Hollinger record boxes; I just counted the first box whose inventory I photocopied, so these figures are approximate. Most of the "B" boxes are not completely full--more like half full.]

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
